wikipedia_page.main: Shahed Ahmed (born 13 September 1985) is an English footballer who plays as a striker for Sporting Bengal United.

response: The Sporting Bengal set-up is unusual in that it is operated by the Bangladesh Football Association (UK) and players are selected from (and retain their affiliation with) the Sunday league clubs which are affiliated to that organisation. In 2011 the club signed up ex Wycombe Wanderers and Wimbledon striker Shahed Ahmed. They were also unusual in being the only Kent League club to play their home matches north of the River Thames, outside the traditional borders of Kent.

In 2010 Sporting Bengal was targeted by the Bangladesh Football Federation for its players to represent the Bangladesh national squad. Sadiq Sarwar and Shahed Ahmed were selected to represent their country at the 2010 South Asian Games.
* Shahed Ahmed (Sporting Bengal United) Former Wycombe Wanderers player.
* Shahed Ahmed – Professional footballer who played as a striker for Wycombe Wanderers. He currently plays for Sporting Bengal United and has now been appointed as captain.
* Shahed Ahmed, English former professional footballer
* Shahed Ahmed  former professional footballer who played as a striker for Wycombe Wanderers He plays for Sporting Bengal United.
